newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: APB opens joint venture brewery in Hainan.
newsitem.headline: APB opens joint venture brewery in Hainan.

text.p: Asia Pacific Breweries Ltd (APB) said on Monday it had opened a brewery in Hainan, China, in a joint venture with Hainan Brewery Company Ltd.
The initial investment in land, plant and machinery for the brewery was US$66 million, APB said in a statement.
APB has an 80 percent stake in the joint venture company, Hainan Asia Pacific Brewery Co Ltd, while the Hainan Brewery Co holds the remaining 20 percent.
The statement said the brewery would produce Tiger and Anchor beer, both APB brands, in bottles, cans and kegs to be sold in South China and other provinces in the country.
It will have an initial technical capacity of 650,000 hectolitres with potential to expand to 3.5 million hectolitres.

APB already owns 40 percent in a brewery in Fuzhou and manages another in Shanghai, which is 35 percent-owned by Asia Pacific Investments Pte Ltd, a joint venture between Fraser & Neave Ltd and Heineken N.V..
